message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on vehicular communications and proposes a cooperative information forwarding scheme, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper derives closed-form results of transmission range gain and improved Information Propagation Speed (IPS), which involves information theory concepts. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The proposed scheme involves the coordination of multiple vehicles to form virtual antenna arrays, which can be seen as a control system. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the transmission of traffic-related information, which can be considered as multimedia data. 
5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - Although not the main focus, the paper briefly mentions the security and privacy concerns of the proposed scheme, which falls under the scope of cryptography and security.
